component.text: Step 2 - Connect the Cables to the Switch
Step 1: Securely Mount and Ground the Device Chassis
Cisco router and ISRs can be wall-mounted, set on a shelf or desktop, or installed in a rack.

Seat the external compact flash memory card into the slot. Be certain that it is firmly seated and verify that the eject button is fully extended. The eject button is usually located to the left of the slot.

Connect the power cable to the device and then to a reliable power source. Routers and networking devices are usually connected to an uninterruptible power supply that contains a battery. This ensures that the device does not fail if the electricity goes off unexpectedly.
Step 4: Configure the Terminal Emulation Software and Connect the PC to the Console Port

On a PC, configure the terminal emulating software with required settings for communication with a Cisco router. Connect the PC running the emulation program to the console port of the ISR using the console cable that came with the device.
Turn the ISR on using the power switch located on the rear of the device.
Observe the start-up messages as they appear in the terminal emulation program window. These messages are generated by the router's operating system.
